p: Analysis of the demographic profiles of women diagnosed with HIV-1 in Israel between the years 2010 and 2018 revealed that most were not born in Israel. In 2010–2012, 44.7% were immigrants from SSA and 31.3% were from the FSU. In more recent years (2016–2018), 50% were from the FSU, while only 27.7% originated from SSA ( p < 0.001). The most prevalent viral subtype, changed accordingly, from subtype C, characteristic of HIV-1 in SSA, in 2010–2012, to subtype A, characteristic to FSU, in 2016–2018 ( p < 0.014). These results are in concordance with the waves of immigration from SSA and Eastern Europe to Israel in 2010–2018. A similar increase in the prevalence of subtype A carriers was recently reported in Germany and in other west-European countries, due to an increased flow of refugees, mainly from the FSU, into Europe, and especially into Germany [ 19].
